thread.title: USA Women 0 England Women 1: Ellen White’s scrambled winner stuns SheBelieves Cup hosts and world champs USA with thrilling last-minute winner

author: aterrell
title: USA Women 0 England Women 1: Ellen White’s scrambled winner stuns SheBelieves Cup hosts and world champs USA with thrilling last-minute winner
text:
EFL ELL'S ANGELS USA Women 0 England Women 1: Ellen White’s scrambled winner stuns SheBelieves Cup hosts and world champs USA with thrilling last-minute winner 
Mark Sampson's side lost their opener 2-1 to France but beat the reigning world champs By Alex Terrell 5th March 2017, 9:34 am Updated: 5th March 2017, 9:43 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ELLEN WHITE’S last-minute goal England Women a 1-0 win over world champions the United States in the SheBelieves Cup at the Red Bull Arena in New Jersey. 
White struck from close range after Lucy Bronze’s superb shot from 25 yards came back off the crossbar. Getty Images 5 Ellen White screams for joy after netting a last-gasp winner for England against USA in New Jersey 
England Women boss Mark Sampson had told his side to prove they could be world-beaters ahead of the ‘Battle of Britain’ with Scotland at Euro 2017. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest FOOTBALL news, gossip and rumours 
After a quiet start, England goalkeeper Siobhan Chamberlain was called into action in the 19th minute to deny Rose Lavelle from close range. Getty Images Ellen White wheels away after netting a scrambled winner from close range for England AP:Associated Press 5 England women celebrate together after scoring a last-minute winner against the United States "Hopefully this will be the start of a new era for us." #Lionesses boss @Mark_Sampson on the famous win over USA: https://t.co/OBK8qWzuyz 
— England (@England) March 5, 2017 
The Lionesses, who announced before the game that defender Casey Stoney will miss the remainder of the competition with a hamstring injury, responded and striker Nikita Parris brought a superb save from Ashlyn Harris with a fierce drive after 32 minutes. 
That gave England confidence and Toni Duggan fired an effort inches over the crossbar shortly afterwards. Getty Images England women manager Mark Sampson celebrates with the players after beating the world champions Getty Images 5 England women all sprint towards the bench after scoring a late winner in New Jersey 
Lavelle fired over early in the second half, while Duggan brought another good stop from Harris with a 25-yard free-kick after 71 minutes. 
England got the winner in the 89th minute when Bronze hit the crossbar and White showed great anticipation to follow up and poke the rebound into the roof of the net from close range. 
England were beaten 2-1 by France on Wednesday and will play Germany in their final game on Tuesday. 
The three matches are a vital part of the Lionesses’ preparations for this summer’s European Championship. 
England also play Italy and Austria in April. FIFA 16: England Women's Trailer
